biography.value:
As part of their quest for godhood, a yuan-ti abomination might perform a ritual that, if successful, transforms them into an even greater form: a yuan-ti anathema. This ritual demands the sacrifice of hundreds of snakes and requires the abomination to bathe in the blood of their enemies. The transformation is quick but painful.

Anathemas consider themselves demigods on the path to greater divinity. They demand obeisance from weaker creatures and use every resource at their disposal to war against neighbors, seeking the captives, sacrifices, glory, and riches the anathemas believe they need to achieve true divinity.

Anathemas donâ€™t age, allowing them to pursue their goals until the end of days. Truly powerful ones might rule multiple yuan-ti cities and bring entire regions under their control.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The anathema makes two Claw attacks and one Flurry of Bites attack.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

description.value:
Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: [[/damage 6d6 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage plus [[/damage 4d6 type=poison average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 15 ft., one Large or smaller creature. Hit: [[/damage 3d6 + @mod type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage plus [[/damage 2d6 type=acid average=true]] damage, and the target is &Reference[grappled]{grappled} (escape DC 16). Until this grapple ends, the target is &Reference[restrained]{restrained}, and it takes [[/damage 3d6 + @mod type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage plus [[/damage 2d6 type=acid average=true]] damage at the start of each of its turns. The anathema can constrict only one creature at a time.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The anathema casts one of the following spells, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components and using &Reference[cha]{Charisma} as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17):

At will: animal friendship (snakes only)

3/day each: darkness, entangle, fear, polymorph, suggestion

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Magic Resistance. The anathema has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Ophidiophobia Aura. Any creature of the anathemaâ€™s choice, other than a snake or a yuan-ti, that starts its turn within 30 feet of the anathema must succeed on a [[/save wis 17 format=long]] or become &Reference[frightened]{frightened} of snakes and yuan-ti. A &Reference[frightened]{frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a targetâ€™s saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this anathamaâ€™s aura for the next 24 hours.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Six Heads. The anathema has advantage on saves against being &Reference[blinded]{blinded}, &Reference[charmed]{charmed}, &Reference[deafened]{deafened}, &Reference[frightened]{frightened}, &Reference[stunned]{stunned}, or knocked &Reference[unconscious]{unconscious}.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The anathema transforms into a Huge constrictor snake or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isnâ€™t transformed.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Special Notes: snakes only.

This spell lets you convince a &Reference[beast]{beast} that you mean it no harm. Choose a &Reference[beast]{beast} that you can see within range. It must see and hear you. If the beast's &Reference[int]{Intelligence} is 4 or higher, the spell fails. Otherwise, the &Reference[beast]{beast} must succeed on a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw or be &Reference[charmed]{charmed} by you for the spell's duration. If you or one of your companions harms the target, the spell ends.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can affect one additional &Reference[beast]{beast} for each slot level above 1st.

Magical darkness spreads from a point you choose within range to fill a 15-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} for the duration. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with &Reference[darkvision]{darkvision} can't see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

If the point you choose is on an object you are holding or one that isn't being worn or carried, the darkness emanates from the object and moves with it. Completely covering the source of the darkness with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helm, blocks the darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.

Grasping weeds and vines sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square starting from a point within range. For the duration, these plants turn the ground in the area into difficult terrain.

A creature in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a &Reference[str]{Strength} saving throw or be &Reference[restrained]{restrained} by the entangling plants until the spell ends. A creature &Reference[restrained]{restrained} by the plants can use its action to make a &Reference[str]{Strength} check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.

When the spell ends, the conjured plants wilt away.

changes.value: You can take an action to break free by rolling a Strength Ability Check
turn=end, rollType=check, actionSave=true, saveAbility=str, saveDC=@attributes.spelldc, label=Restrained by Entangle

description.value:
You project a phantasmal image of a creatureâ€™s worst fears. Each creature in a 30-foot &Reference[cone]{cone} must succeed on a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw or drop whatever it is holding and become &Reference[frightened]{frightened} for the duration.

While &Reference[frightened]{frightened} by this spell, a creature must take the Dash action and move away from you by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move. If the creature ends its turn in a location where it doesnâ€™t have &Reference[line]{line} of sight to you, the creature can make a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends for that creature.

This spell transforms a creature that you can see within range into a new form. An unwilling creature must make a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw to avoid the effect. The spell has no effect on a shapechanger or a creature with 0 hit points.

The transformation lasts for the duration, or until the target drops to 0 hit points or dies. The new form can be any &Reference[beast]{beast} whose challenge rating is equal to or less than the target's (or the target's level, if it doesn't have a challenge rating). The target's game statistics, including mental ability scores, are replaced by the statistics of the chosen &Reference[beast]{beast}. It retains its alignment and personality.

The target assumes the hit points of its new form. When it reverts to its normal form, the creature returns to the number of hit points it had before it transformed. If it reverts as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to its normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce the creature's normal form to 0 hit points, it isn't knocked &Reference[unconscious]{unconscious}.

The creature is limited in the actions it can perform by the &Reference[nat]{nature} of its new form, and it can't speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech.

The target's gear melds into the new form. The creature can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment.

You suggest a course of activity (limited to a sentence or two) and magically influence a creature you can see within range that can hear and understand you. Creatures that can't be &Reference[charmed]{charmed} are immune to this effect. The suggestion must be worded in such a manner as to make the course of action sound reasonable. Asking the creature to stab itself, throw itself onto a spear, immolate itself, or do some other obviously harmful act ends the spell.

The target must make a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw. On a failed save, it pursues the course of action you described to the best of its ability. The suggested course of action can continue for the entire duration. If the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends when the subject finishes what it was asked to do.

You can also specify conditions that will trigger a special activity during the duration. For example, you might suggest that a knight give her warhorse to the first beggar she meets. If the condition isn't met before the spell expires, the activity isn't performed.

If you or any of your companions damage the target, the spell ends.
